Source.Name: teamviewer
Source.Description: TeamViewer is a computer software for remote control, desktop sharing, and file transfer between Linux, Windows and Apple computers. TeamViewer is free for personal use. You can use TeamViewer completely free of charge to access your private computers or to help your friends with their computer problems. To buy a license for commercial use, please visit http://www.teamviewer.com

Update.Comment: Cleaning up build files for TeamViewer PiSi package: * pspec.xml: Icon: teamviewer (insted of qnext) * pspec.xml: PartOf: network (insted of network.chat) * pspec.xml: Files-Path: no need duplicate data-attributes for directories under /usr/; one data-definition for /usr/ is enough; added doc for /usr/share/doc/ * pspec.xml: white spaces (4 spaces) as tabulator * pspec.xml: removing unneeded spaces at line end * pspec.xml and translations.xml:new English and German summary and description texts * actions.py and pspec.xml: using official rpm package form teamviewer.com as source archive (no need for comar-download-script) * added help-file to integrate TeamViewer specific help into KDE's Help-Center
